Convert graph to dot format

Source: R/io.R
write_dot.Rd

Convert graph to dot format

write_dot(
  graph,
  outfile = stdout(),
  fontsize = 14,
  color = TRUE,
  hide_weights = FALSE,
  size1 = 7.5,
  size2 = 10,
  title = "",
  highlight_unidentifiable = FALSE,
  nodesep = 0.25,
  ranksep = 0.5,
  fix_names = FALSE,
  dot2pdf = FALSE
)

Arguments

graph

Graph as igraph object or edge list (columns labelled 'from', 'to', 'weight')
outfile

Output file name
fontsize

Font size of edge and node labels
color

A boolean specifying if the plot will be in color or grey scale.
hide_weights

A boolean value specifying if the drift values on the edges will be hidden. The default is FALSE.
highlight_unidentifiable

Highlight unidentifiable edges in red. Can be slow for large graphs.
nodesep

The minimum space between two adjacent nodes in the same rank, in inches. The default is 0.25.
ranksep

Sets the rank separation, in inches. This is the minimum vertical distance between the bottom of the nodes in one rank and the tops of nodes in the next. The default is 0.5.
fix_names

If TRUE, replaces the dots (.) and dashes (-) in population names with underscores. The default is FALSE.
dot2pdf

If FALSE, the function will terminate after writing the dot file. If TRUE, it will try to execute the dot -Tpdf comment to create pdf file.

Examples

if (FALSE) {
results = qpgraph(example_f2_blocks, example_graph)
write_dot(results$edges)
}
